thread.title_full: Yemeni Houthis Take Direct Action Against Gaza Genocide - YES! Magazine Solutions Journalism

author: Sonali Kolhatkar
title: Yemeni Houthis Take Direct Action Against Gaza Genocide - YES! Magazine Solutions Journalism
text: Yemeni Houthis Take Direct Action Against Gaza Genocide Houthi fighters from Yemen have been [attacking commercial cargo ships and oil tankers](https://www.vox.com/world-politics/24010092/houthis-red-sea-shipping-yemen-israel-gaza) in the Red Sea in an attempt to [thwart Israel’s ongoing genocide in Gaza](https://www.aljazeera.com/podcasts/2024/1/10/the-take-the-houthis-grip-on-red-sea-trade), in solidarity with Palestinians. In response, the [United States and United Kingdom](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/jan/12/yemen-houthi-rebels-who-are-they-what-attacking-us-uk-airstrikes-red-sea-crisis) have launched airstrikes against Yemen, risking a wider regional war. [Isa Blumi](https://www.su.se/english/profiles/iblum-1.253921), docent/associate professor of Turkish and Middle Eastern Studies at Stockholm University and author of [Destroying Yemen: What Chaos in Arabia Tell Us About the World](https://academic.oup.com/california-scholarship-online/book/30663), spoke with YES! Senior Editor Sonali Kolhatkar on YES Presents: Rising Up With Sonali about the Yemeni fighters. | |[Sonali Kolhatkar](https://www.yesmagazine.org/authors/sonali-kolhatkar)joined YES! in summer 2021, building on a long and decorated career in broadcast and print journalism. She is an award-winning multimedia journalist, and host and creator of YES! Presents: Rising Up with Sonali, a nationally syndicated television and radio program airing on Free Speech TV and dozens of independent and community radio stations. She is also Senior Correspondent with the Independent Media Institute’s Economy for All project where she writes a weekly column. She is the author of Rising Up: The Power of Narrative in Pursuing Racial Justice (2023) and Bleeding Afghanistan: Washington, Warlords, and the Propaganda of Silence (2005). Her forthcoming book is called Talking About Abolition (Seven Stories Press, 2025). Sonali is co-director of the nonprofit group, Afghan Women’s Mission which she helped to co-found in 2000. She has a Master’s in Astronomy from the University of Hawai’i, and two undergraduate degrees in Physics and Astronomy from the University of Texas at Austin. Sonali reflects on “My Journey From Astrophysicist to Radio Host” in her 2014 [TEDx talk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rqzi9hYCVTU&ab_channel=TEDxTalks)of the same name.
